maml:description.maml:para: Get features and information for a given API Key.
Get features and information for a given API Key.
Shodan API Key to get information on.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Shodan API Key to get information on.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Shodan API Key to get information on.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ShodanAPIInfo
Unlocked_Left : 88 Telnet : True Plan : dev HTTPS : True Unlocked : True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get information on API key currently set using the Set-ShodanAPIKey command.

maml:description.maml:para: Look up the IP address for the provided list of hostnames.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resolve an IP Address to its known hostname in the Shodan service.

maml:description.maml:para: List all services that Shodan crawls
This command returns an object containing all the services that the Shodan crawlers look at. It can also be used as a quick and practical way to resolve a port number to the name of a service.
Get your current IP address as seen from the Internet.
Get your current IP address as seen from the Internet.

Returns the total number of results that matched the query and any facet information that was requested.
Returns the total number of results that matched the query and any facet information that was requested. As a result this method does not consume query credits.
Shodan API key to use to query the service.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

Shodan search query. The provided string is used to search the database of banners in Shodan, with the additional option to provide filters inside the search query using a "filter:value" format. For example, the following search query would find Apache webservers located in Germany: "apache country:DE".
Show results that are located in the given city.
Show results that are located within the given country.

There are 2 modes to the geo filter: radius and bounding box. To limit results based on a radius around a pair of latitude/ longitude, provide 3 parameters; ex: geo:50,50,100. If you want to find all results within a bounding box, supply the top left and bottom right coordinates for the region; ex: geo:10,10,50,50.
Search for hosts that contain the given value in their hostname.
Search by netblock using CIDR notation; ex: net:69.84.207.0/24
Filter results based on the operating system of the device.
Search the HTML of the website for the given value.
Find devices based on the upstream owner of the IP netblock.
Find devices depending on their connection to the Internet.
Find NTP servers that had the given IP in their monlist.
Find NTP servers that return the given number of IPs in the initial monlist response.
Find NTP servers that had IPs with the given port in their monlist.
Whether or not more IPs were available for the given NTP server.
Find devices based on the owner of the IP netblock.
Filter using the name of the software/ product; ex: product:Apache
Filter the results to include only products of the given version; ex: product:apache version:1.3.37
Search the title of the website.
Find devices based on the services/ ports that are publicly exposed on the Internet.
Only show results that were collected before the given date (dd/mm/yyyy.
Only show results that were collected after the given date (dd/mm/yyyy).
The page number to page through results 100 at a time. Overrides the "offset" and "limit" parameters if they were provided
The positon from which the search results should be returned (default: 0)
The number of results to be returned default(100)
Whether or not to truncate some of the larger fields (default: True)

A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on. Property names can also be in the format of "property:count", where "count" is the number of facets that will be returned for a property (i.e. "country:100" to get the top 100 countries for a search query).
Shodan API key to use to query the service.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Password to decrypt the stored API Key.
Search across a variety of data sources for exploits. using Shodan
Search across a variety of data sources for exploits and refine the search using facets.
Shodan API key to use for query if one is not set.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on.
Search query used to search the database of known exploits.
CVE ID
OpenSource Vulnerability Databse ID
SecurityFocus BID Number
Microsoft Buletin (MS012-020)
The operating system that the exploit targets.
The category of exploit, possible values are: - dos - exploit - local - remote - shellcode - webapps
The port number for the affected service if the exploit is remote.
The author of the exploit/ vulnerability.
When the exploit was released format day/month/year
The description of the exploit, how it works and where it applies.
The title or short description for the exploit if available.
Shodan API key to use for query if one is not set.

Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on.
Search query used to search the database of known exploits.
CVE ID
OpenSource Vulnerability Databse ID
SecurityFocus BID Number
Microsoft Buletin (MS012-020)
The operating system that the exploit targets.
The category of exploit, possible values are: - dos - exploit - local - remote - shellcode - webapps
The port number for the affected service if the exploit is remote.
The author of the exploit/ vulnerability.
When the exploit was released format day/month/year
The description of the exploit, how it works and where it applies.
The title or short description for the exploit if available.
Shodan API key to use for query if one is not set.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on.

CVE ID
OpenSource Vulnerability Databse ID
SecurityFocus BID Number
Microsoft Buletin (MS012-020)
The operating system that the exploit targets.
The category of exploit, possible values are: - dos - exploit - local - remote - shellcode - webapps
The port number for the affected service if the exploit is remote.
The author of the exploit/ vulnerability.
When the exploit was released format day/month/year
The description of the exploit, how it works and where it applies.
The title or short description for the exploit if available.
Uses a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the Internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.

Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.

Uses the credentials of the current user to access the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter.
This parameter is valid only when the Proxy parameter is also used in the command. You cannot use the ProxyCredential and ProxyUseDefaultCredentials parameters in the same command.
Search Shodan using the same query syntax as the website and use facets to get summary information for different properties.

Search Shodan using the same query syntax as the website and use facets to get summary information for different properties.
Requirements This method may use API query credits depending on usage. If any of the following criteria are met, your account will be deducted 1 query credit:
The search query contains a filter. Accessing results past the 1st page using the "page" or "offset/ limit" parameters. For every 100 results past the 1st page 1 query credit is deducted.
Shodan API key to use to query the service.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.

Shodan search query. The provided string is used to search the database of banners in Shodan, with the additional option to provide filters inside the search query using a "filter:value" format. For example, the following search query would find Apache webservers located in Germany: "apache country:DE".
Show results that are located in the given city.
Show results that are located within the given country.

There are 2 modes to the geo filter: radius and bounding box. To limit results based on a radius around a pair of latitude/ longitude, provide 3 parameters; ex: geo:50,50,100. If you want to find all results within a bounding box, supply the top left and bottom right coordinates for the region; ex: geo:10,10,50,50.
Search for hosts that contain the given value in their hostname.
Search by netblock using CIDR notation; ex: net:69.84.207.0/24
Filter results based on the operating system of the device.
Search the HTML of the website for the given value.
Find devices based on the upstream owner of the IP netblock.
Find devices depending on their connection to the Internet.
Find NTP servers that had the given IP in their monlist.
Find NTP servers that return the given number of IPs in the initial monlist response.
Find NTP servers that had IPs with the given port in their monlist.
Whether or not more IPs were available for the given NTP server.
Find devices based on the owner of the IP netblock.
Filter using the name of the software/ product; ex: product:Apache
Filter the results to include only products of the given version; ex: product:apache version:1.3.37
Search the title of the website.
Find devices based on the services/ ports that are publicly exposed on the Internet.
Only show results that were collected before the given date (dd/mm/yyyy).
Only show results that were collected after the given date (dd/mm/yyyy).
The page number to page through results 100 at a time. Overrides the "offset" and "limit" parameters if they were provided (default: 1)
The positon from which the search results should be returned (default: 0)
The number of results to be returned default(100)
Whether or not to truncate some of the larger fields (default: True)

A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on. Property names can also be in the format of "property:count", where "count" is the number of facets that will be returned for a property (i.e. "country:100" to get the top 100 countries for a search query).
Shodan API key to use to query the service.

Specifies the digital public key certificate (X509) of a user account that has permission to send the request. Enter the certificate thumbprint of the certificate.
Certificates are used in client certificate-based authentication. They can be mapped only to local user accounts; they do not work with domain accounts. To get a certificate thumbprint, use the Get-Item or Get-ChildItem command in the Windows PowerShell Cert: drive.
